author: senh
title: Fake Hotel Booking Sites Stir Travel Turmoil
text: BING NEWS: Fake Hotel Booking Sites Stirring Up Turmoil for Travelers "Just because a webpage looks like the official site of your favorite hotel chain doesn't mean it is," the Federal Trade Commission warned in a recent blog post. Unlike legitimate resellers, these fake sites use ... they were charged booking fees that ... 07/20/2015 - 5:11 am | View Link Shakespeare's birthplace bans selfie sticks Since then they have caused a stir and the sale of unlicensed selfie-sticks was banned ... Tourist attraction site AttractionTix analysed Instagram keywords to find mentions of travel hotspots alongside the world 'selfie', and have compiled a list of ... 07/6/2015 - 1:00 pm | View Link Has email killed the formal invite? One in five young couples now use Facebook or other sites to ask family and friends to join their celebrations One in five young couples now invite friends and family to join their celebrations via Facebook and other social media sites, a survey has found ... Researchers from hotel booking site Laterooms.com surveyed 2,000 couples who were either recently married ... 06/7/2015 - 12:19 pm | View Link Sweden hotels win Booking.com price row Booking.com is still embroiled in negotiations in other European countries and faces legal action by France's top hotel group Accor. Talks are also ongoing between France's competition commission and two other reservation sites, Expedia and HRS. 04/21/2015 - 4:15 am | View Link Exploring the art and soul of the streets of Beijing Itâ€™s easy to get a taxi from your hotel, but flagging one down in the street can be harder.
